content: the vest is knitted in two-color stranded knitting bottom up in stockinette stitch following diagrams steeking creates slits on both sides and is also used for the armholes and neck opening the shoulders are knitted together steeks are crocheted cut and sewn finally the ribbed edges neck armholes and hem with double-knit side slits are added **note this garment has only been test-knitted in one size although carefully calculated if you have any feedback feel free to contact me on ravelry ** **version b published march 2nd 25** **sizes** 1 2 3 one way of finding the right size is picking a sweater with the desired fit measure it and pick the finished garment size with the chest circumference closest to it or measure your own circumference and choose a size that has a circumference circa 15-20 cm larger than yours the 15-20 cm is the positive ease **finished measurements of the garment** chest circumference ca 105 120 135 cm full length from back neck to hem 52 54 56 cm body length armhole to hem 29 31 33 cm **materials** yarn 7 8 9 skeins of sandnes peer gynt base colour and 1 sandnes silk mohair 1 sandnes alpaka følgetråd the silk mohair and alpaca are held together and is the contrast color tip use a mix of leftovers yarns as the contrast color the gauge is forgiving when the base is the same **needles** 4mm 3mm for ribbing notions sts markers to mark digram start/end also a st holder **gauge** 18 sts x 23 row = 10x10 cm on us xx / 5 mm needles in 2 color stranded colorwork in stockinette stitch after blocking
